Vocabularies.Definition: n. 宅旁私家车道
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  A driveway is a road for vehicles that connects a private house or garage with the street.

Vocabularies.Definition: v.  修剪（草坪）；刈（草）
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The grass is getting too long, we must mow the lawn.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt. understand fully
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The child read the story but did not comprehend its full meaning.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 草地，草坪
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Let's have tea on the lawn.

Vocabularies.Definition: refuse to help (sb.) or to allow (sb.) to enter a place 拒绝帮助；不让…进入
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The hall was full, and hundreds of fans had to be turned away.

Vocabularies.Definition: v. 除去…的杂草；除草 n.杂草，野草
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  A weed is an unwanted wild plant, esp. one which prevents crops or garden flowers from growing properly.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt. suppose 假设；以为
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  If he's not here in five minutes, we'll assume (that) he isn't coming.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt. praise 赞扬 n. 赞美的言辞或行为
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  I must compliment you on the way you handled the meeting.

Vocabularies.Definition: plan; solve; calculate 制定出；解决；算出
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Have you worked out the answer/ the sum yet?

Vocabularies.Definition: a. happening once a week or every week 每周的；一周一次的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Are you paid weekly or monthly?

Vocabularies.Definition: make clean and tidy 打扫，清除
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  It's your turn to clean (the kitchen) up.

Vocabularies.Definition: a. giving help; useful 有帮助的；有用的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  It was very helpful of you to do that typing for me.

Vocabularies.Definition: (used in questions with what) 对待，处理
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  What have you done with my book?

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 决心；决定
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The police chief spoke of his determination to catch the killer.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  人事部门；全体人员，全体职员
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The company's main problem is the shortage of skilled personnel.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 学徒
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The company is taking on four new apprentices.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  the ability to understand or do sth. 能力，才能
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  He has a great capacity for enjoying himself.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 测微计，千分尺
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  A micrometer is an instrument for measuring very small objects.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. the quality of being exact 精密；精确（性）
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Scientific instruments have to be made with great precision.

Vocabularies.Definition: refuse 拒绝
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Thank you, but I'll have to turn down your offer.

Vocabularies.Definition: v. （使）毕业 n. （尤指大学）毕业生
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  She graduated from Oxford with a first-class degree in physics.

Vocabularies.Definition: a. having skill; needing skill 熟练的，有技巧的；技术性的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  We need skilled workers / workers skilled in welding for this job; it is a highly skilled job.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  磨工
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  a coffee grinder

Vocabularies.Definition: (ground)vt. 磨，磨碎，碾碎
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  We grind (up) the wheat to make flour.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 工具，器械，仪器
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The pilot studied his instruments.

Vocabularies.Definition: intended to be sold 待售
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  This picture is only on display; it's not for sale.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 残破物（尤指失事船只、飞机等的）残骸
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The car was a total wreck.

Vocabularies.Definition: visit (sb.) for a short time 拜访
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  We can call on Mary tomorrow.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 银行家；银行高级职员
vt. lend (sth.) 借，贷 n. 贷款；借，贷
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Can you loan me your tennis racket?

Vocabularies.Definition: n. （人的）品德；品质；性格
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The twins look alike but have very different characters.

Vocabularies.Definition: a., n. (infml) (usu. used in negatives) of even the smallest amount 丝毫
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  His promise isn't worth a damn.

Vocabularies.Definition: ad.  勉强地
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  She reluctantly accepted the money.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 抵押借款，按揭
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  My mortgage is with a small building society.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt. (fml) throw away 抛弃
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  I've discarded my old coat.

Vocabularies.Definition: (also: odds and sods) 零星杂物，琐碎物品
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  He's moved most of his stuff; there are only a few odds and ends left.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 纱门，纱窗；屏；荧屏
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  They put a screen around his bed so the doctor could examine him.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 五金器具；（计算机的）硬件
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  You can buy what you need in that hardware store.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. a particular place; a small dirty mark 地点；斑点
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  On this map X marks the spot where the treasure is buried.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 信心
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  She's a good student but she lacks confidence.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt. surprise (sb.) very much 使惊愕，使诧异
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Your knowledge amazes me.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  辣椒；胡椒粉
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  I bought some green peppers for the salad.

Vocabularies.Definition: a. 意大利的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Can you tell me something about Italian history?

Vocabularies.Definition: n. food and drink usually taken by a person or group日常饮食
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  A balanced diet and regular exercise are both important for health.

Vocabularies.Definition: ask for the arrival of 派人去叫，召唤；派人去取
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  We may have to send to Japan for the spare parts.

Vocabularies.Definition: v. 寻找；打猎
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  I have hunted high and low (= everywhere) for my socks.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt. give up completely or forever 抛弃，放弃
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  When the fire got out of control, the captain told the sailors to abandon ship.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. land, buildings or both together; sth. which is owned（房）地产；财产
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  That car is my property; you mustn't use it without my permission.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 小屋，棚 vt. 使脱落；使流出，散发出
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The army brought down the government, but without shedding blood.

Vocabularies.Definition: ad.  某个时候
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  We'll take our holiday sometime in August, I think.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt. 为…做保证人；主办，发起 n. 保证人；主办者，发起人
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The competition was sponsored by a big corporation.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt. cause to laugh or smile; cause to spend time in a pleasant manner 逗乐，给...提供娱乐
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  His silly jokes amused the children.

Vocabularies.Definition: v. come near/nearer to 接近
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The time is approaching when we will have to leave.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 惊愕，诧异
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  To my amazement I came first.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  百万富翁
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  She leads a simple life though her father is a millionaire.

Vocabularies.Definition: (euph) (esp. of a person) die 去世
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  She passed away in her sleep.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt. manage; control 管理，处理；操纵
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  She didn't know how to handle the problem.

Vocabularies.Definition: a. fit or pleasant to live in 适于居住的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The house is not livable.

Vocabularies.Definition: a.(infml) pleasant; like home 舒适的；像家一样的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  a large, homey dining room

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 拖拉机
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The tractor is the most widely used agricultural machine.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 身材，身高；境界
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  She had not yet gown to (her) full stature.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 工业家，实业家
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Professor Welch is writing an essay about some great industrialists of this country.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 路线；路程
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  What's the shortest route from London to Cambridge?

Vocabularies.Definition: n. guiding rule for behavior; basic truth 信条；原则；原理
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  One of the principles of this dictionary is that definitions should be in simple language.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. the ability to make great plans for the future; sight; the ability to see 远见；视觉，视力
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  I've had my eyes tested and the optician（眼镜商）says that my vision is perfect.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 乐观主义
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  There is a note of optimism in his voice.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. proper respect for oneself 自尊;自重
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  She's got too much self-respect to beg her boyfriend to stay.

Vocabularies.Definition: most important of all 最重要的是
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  And above all, remember to send us your comments.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. quality of being honest and responsible; state of being complete 正直；完整
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Our integrity as a nation is threatened by these separatist forces.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.（梯子的）横档，梯级
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The director made his son start on the bottom rung of the ladder as an office boy.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  地下室
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  She lives in a basement.

Vocabularies.Definition: a. of great size or force 巨大的 n. 巨人
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The giant (size) package gives you more for less money.

Vocabularies.Definition: in spite of what has been said or done 毕竟, 终究
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  It has turned out to be a nice day after all.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 平衡；余额
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  I found it hard to keep my balance on the icy path.

Vocabularies.Definition: 资产负债表
n. 小数
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  You know 0.6 is a decimal because there's a decimal point between the 0 and 6.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt. produce or make (esp. sth. new) 创造，创作
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The project will create up to 60 new jobs.

Vocabularies.Word: Tony Trivisonno 托尼·特里韦索诺
Frederick C. Crawford 弗雷德里克·C·克罗弗德
